title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: The story of racial injustice in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about totalitarian surveillance society.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic tale about societal expectations and love in 19th-century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of wealth, ambition, and the American Dream in the 1920s.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of the quest to capture the elusive white whale, Moby-Dick.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel about teenage rebellion and identity.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The adventurous tale of Bilbo Baggins' journey to the Lonely Mountain.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian vision of a technologically advanced but dehumanized society.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The beginning of Frodo's epic journey to destroy the One Ring.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A journey of self-discovery and following one's dreams.
